availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
REQUISITION FOR FUGITIVE FROM JUSTICE.
TO HIS EXCELLENCY,
The Governor of the State of Kentucky

It appears by the annexed papers, duly authenticated according to the laws of our State, that Albert Catlin (alias Charles Clark) stands charged by Affidavit before S. S Stuteville a Justice of the Peace in Spencer Co Ind, with the crime of Burglary and it has been represented to me that he has fled from the justice of this State and has taken refuge in the State of Kentucky

NOW, THEREFORE, I Conrad Baker Lieut. Gov. acting as Governor of the State of Indiana, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the United States, do, by these presents, demand that the said Albert Catlin (alias Charles Clark) be apprehended and delivered to Robert Graham who is hereby authorized to receive and convey him to the State of Indiana, that he may abide his trial for the crime with which he stands charged. "The State will pay no part of the expenses of the execution of this Writ."

In Testomony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused to be affixed the Seal of the State, at the City of Indianapolis, this Twenty Fifth day of December in the year of our Lord One Thousand Eight Hundred and Sixty Five, the Fiftieth year of the State, and of the Independence of the United State the Ninetieth

BY THE GOVERNOR:
Conrad Baker
Lieutenant Gov acting as Governor
Nelson Trusler SECRETARY OF STATE

Requisition from Gov Indiana for Albert Catlin alias Chas Clark
Warrant issued 26th Dec/6
